intro: Solanum perianthomega, commonly known as the golden bell pepper plant, is a member of the nightshade family (Solanaceae). It is characterized by its vibrant yellow and orange flowers that resemble small bells, hence its common name. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are broad and ovate, with a slightly hairy texture, and its fruits are small, round, and develop from the flowers. Solanum perianthomega is cultivated for its ornamental value and has also been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
